required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Importance of ENDING-S Score in the Diagnosis of Palliative Patients in the Intensive Care Unit
clinical_study.official_title: The Importance of ENDING-S Score in the Diagnosis of Palliative Patients in the Intensive Care Unit

brief_summary.textblock: In our study, we aim to predict palliative care patients earlier, to reduce hospitalization periods and to prevent intensive care unit occupation by palliative care patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Recognition of palliative care unit patients before intensive care discharge
primary_outcome.time_frame: Fourth day of intensive care follow up
primary_outcome.description: ENDING-S Scoring system used to predict patients who were followed up in intensive care units and discharged to palliative care unit during their hospitalization. We aim to identify patients who are likely to be admitted to palliative care centers following their admission to intensive care units, and to prepare a palliative care center before the discharge from the intensive care.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients older than 18 years will be included in the study. Patients staying longer than 48 hours intensive care will be included in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients younger than 18 years. Patients staying less than 48 hours

overall_official.affiliation: Ministry of Health Ankara City Hospital

facility.name: Ministry of Health Ankara City Hospital
